FRQ.question: McCulloch v. Maryland
FRQ.answer: Established supremacy of the U.S. Constitution and federal laws over state laws

FRQ.question: Marbury v. Madison
FRQ.answer: Established the principle of judicial review empowering the Supreme Court

FRQ.question: Schenck v. United States
FRQ.answer: Speech creating a "clear and present danger" is not protected by the First Amendment

FRQ.question: Baker v. Carr
FRQ.answer: Opened the door to equal protection challenges to redistricting and the development of the "one person, one vote" doctrine

FRQ.question: Engel v. Vitale
FRQ.answer: School sponsorship of religious activities violates the establishment clause

FRQ.question: Gideon v. Wainwright
FRQ.answer: Guaranteed the right to an attorney for the poor or indigent

FRQ.question: Miranda v. Arizona
FRQ.answer: upon arrest, a suspect has the right to remain silent and the right to consult with a lawyer

FRQ.question: Tinker v. Des Moines Independent Community School District
FRQ.answer: Public school students have the right to wear black armbands in school to protest the Vietnam War

FRQ.question: New York Times Co. v. United States
FRQ.answer: Bolstered the freedom of the press, establishing a "heavy presumption against prior restraint"

FRQ.question: Wisconsin v. Yoder
FRQ.answer: Compelling Amish students to attend school past the eighth grade violates the free exercise clause

FRQ.question: Roe v. Wade
FRQ.answer: Extended the right of privacy to a woman's decision to have an abortion

FRQ.question: Shaw v. Reno
FRQ.answer: Race cannot be the predominant factor in drawing electoral districts, redistricting subject to strict scrutiny

FRQ.question: United States v. Lopez
FRQ.answer: Congress may not use the commerce clause to make possession of a gun in a school zone a federal crime

FRQ.question: McDonald v. Chicago
FRQ.answer: The Second Amendment right to keep and bear arms for self

FRQ.question: Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission (FEC)
FRQ.answer: Political spending by corporations, associations, and labor unions is a form of protected speech under the First Amendment

FRQ.question: Miranda v. Arizona
FRQ.answer: upon arrest, a suspect has the right to remain silent and the right to consult with a lawyer
